original_title: Sri Lanka sells Rs24.5 billion bills post – auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT -Sri Lanka has sold 24.5 billion worth of treasury bills after the May 25,2023 auction in a phase 2 offer.
In the original auction the debt office sold 124.8 billion rupees of Treasury bills after offering 160 billion with most of the money coming from three months and one year bills.
The debt office sold 64.3 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 25.66 percent, up 19 basis points from a week earlier, after offering 80 billion rupees.
24.8 billion rupees in 6-month bills were sold at 25.30 percent, up 8 basis points from a week earlier after offering 40 billion rupees.
35.6 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 22.97 percent, up 18 basis points from a week earlier after offering 40 billion.
